comments:
I put the following plugin_customization.ini entries to see if the Web Services
wizard would default correctly:

org.eclipse.jst.ws.consumption.ui/PREFERENCE_SERVER=org.eclipse.jst.server.tomc
at.50
org.eclipse.jst.ws.consumption.ui/PREFERENCE_RUNTIME=org.eclipse.jst.ws.axis.cr
eation.axisWebServiceRT
org.eclipse.jst.ws.consumption.ui/PREFERENCE_J2EE_VERSION=1.4

I have also tried using "14" for the J2EE version. When I go to Preferences => 
Web Services => Server and Runtime, the following dialog box pops up:

Could Not Accept Changes

(X) The currently displayed page contains invalid values.

The drop-down lists are blank. I have verified that the settings are being read
correctly by querying PersistentServerRuntimeContext's methods (e.g. 
getServerFactoryId()).

I will send more information to Rupam.

I think this traceback occurred when I got the error dialog in the preferences.
So far, this problem appears to be restricted to the preferences and not to the
Web Services Wizard itself.

Yen,

On WTP M5, I launched with "-pluginCustomization d:\wtp-
stuff\plugin_customization.ini". My ini file looked like below and the 
preferences came up fine. Note that using "1.4" for the J2EE version will fail. 
You must use "14". I'll drop by tomorrow to see what might be causing the 
problem on your end before returning this.

My plugin_customization.ini:

# plugin_customization.ini 
# sets default values for plug-in-specific preferences
# keys are qualified by plug-in id
# e.g., com.example.acmeplugin/myproperty=myvalue
# java.io.Properties file (ISO 8859-1 with "\" escapes)
# "%key" are externalized strings defined in plugin_customization.properties
# This file does not need to be translated.

# Web services customizations
org.eclipse.jst.ws.consumption.ui/PREFERENCE_SERVER=org.eclipse.jst.server.tomca
t.50
org.eclipse.jst.ws.consumption.ui/PREFERENCE_RUNTIME=org.eclipse.jst.ws.axis.cre
ation.axisWebServiceRT
org.eclipse.jst.ws.consumption.ui/PREFERENCE_J2EE_VERSION=14

Created an attachment (id=24646)
apply to org.eclipse.jst.ws.consumption.ui

patch 1 of 1

The attached patch is ready to be comitted.

The plugin_customization.ini mechanism is working fine. The problem with the 
preference page not coming up is occuring because 

ServerCore.findServerType(serverFactoryId)

is returning null for WebSphere 5.0 server types. This may be because a server 
runtime for that server type is not configured. This is not consistent with the 
behaviour for Tomcat, where there need not be a runtime configured in order to 
get a non-null server type (and label) for Tomcat server factory ids. The 
attached patch fixes this by checking for a null server type in the code that 
forms the list of server factory ids/labels for the preference page. We can 
pursue the reasons why null is being returned in certain cases after 0.7.
Thanks - Patch reviewed and committed. I'll release later today.
